Subsection.Text: No person shall hinder, molest or interfere with any person doing anything that the person is authorized to do by or under this section or prevent or attempt to prevent any person from doing any such thing and, notwithstanding any other Act or law, every person shall, unless unable to do so, do everything required by or under this section.
In this section,

Definition.Text: authorized person means a person authorized in writing by the Commission for the purposes of this section;
judge means a judge of a superior court having jurisdiction in the province where the matter arises or a judge of the Federal Court.

Section.Text: When an employer, claimant or other person gives the Commission written, oral or documentary evidence required for the proper determination of the entitlement of a claimant to benefits, the giving of the evidence is an occasion of qualified privilege.

If, because of the failure or neglect of any person to comply with this Act or the regulations, another person loses the right to claim, in whole or in part, any benefits to which the person would otherwise be entitled, the Commission may nevertheless pay the benefits.

Subsection.Text: If a question specified in section 90 arises in any legal proceedings, the justice, judge or court before whom it arises shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: refer the question to an authorized officer of the Canada Revenue Agency under that section and defer further proceedings until the officer’s ruling is received, if the question has not been decided by the authorized officer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on receipt of the ruling, proceed with the hearing and judgment of the legal proceedings.

Subsection.Text: If an appeal has been made under section 91 or 103, the justice, judge or court shall defer judgment until

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a decision of the Minister of National Revenue is received, in the case of an appeal under section 91; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a decision of the Tax Court of Canada is received, in the case of an appeal under section 103.

Subsection.Text: If a question that could be decided by the Commission arises in any legal proceedings, the justice, judge or court before whom the question arises shall refer the question to the Commission and defer further proceedings until the Commission’s decision is received.

If an appeal from a decision of the Commission, or a person authorized by the Commission, is pending on the question arising in any legal proceedings, the justice, judge or court before whom the question arises shall defer further proceedings until the appeal decision is received.

On receipt of the decision, the justice, judge or court shall proceed with the hearing and judgment and, in any proceedings under this Act, the decision is conclusive except in accordance with the Federal Courts Act.
In any proceedings under this Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a document appearing to be a resolution, record or other proceeding of the Commission or other proceeding under this Act or a copy of it, and appearing to be certified by a Commissioner or the Secretary of the Commission,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a document appearing to be, or appearing to be a copy of or extract from,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a document in the custody of the Commission or a document issued under this Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an entry in any books or records in the custody of the Commission,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: and appearing to be certified by the Commission or a person employed in the administration of this Act,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a document appearing to be certified by the Commission or a person employed in the administration of this Act and stating the amount of any contributions paid, payable or owing or the amount of any benefits or other amount paid to or owing by any person, or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a document appearing

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to be, or to be a copy of or extract from, any of the following, namely, an employer’s register, books, pay sheets, records of wages, ledgers, accounts or other documents, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to be certified by an inspector or other person employed in the administration of this Act to whom the documents mentioned in subparagraph (i) were produced under this Act,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is evidence of the facts appearing in the document without proof of the signature or official character of the person appearing to have signed the certificate and without further proof.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Act and the regulations and any proceedings under them, a document appearing to be a certificate of the Commission or a person authorized by the Commission to the effect that a notice, request, demand or other document was sent by mail is evidence that the notice, request, demand or other document was received by the addressee in the ordinary course of the mails.
In any proceedings under this Act or the regulations, a print that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made from a photographic film or from a document in electronic form made by the Commission for the purpose of keeping a permanent record of a document, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: certified by the Commission or a person employed in the administration of this Act

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: is admissible in evidence for all purposes for which the recorded document would be admitted as evidence in the proceedings without proof of the signature or official character of the person appearing to have signed the certificate.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, a reference to a document in this section includes a document in electronic form.
Every person is guilty of an offence punishable on summary conviction who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in relation to a claim for benefits, makes a representation that the person knows to be false or misleading;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: being required under this Act or the regulations to provide information, provides information or makes a representation the person knows to be false or misleading;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly fails to declare to the Commission all or some of their earnings for a period determined under the regulations for which they claimed benefits;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: makes a claim or declaration that the person knows is false or misleading because of the non-disclosure of facts;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: being the payee of a special warrant, knowingly negotiates or attempts to negotiate it for benefits to which the person is not entitled;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: knowingly fails to return a special warrant, or the amount or any excess amounts, as required by section 44;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: imports or exports a document issued by the Commission, or has it imported or exported, for the purpose of defrauding or deceiving the Commission; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: participates in, assents to or acquiesces in an act or omission mentioned in paragraphs (a) to (f).

Subsection.Text: No prosecution for an offence under this section shall be instituted if a penalty for that offence has been imposed under section 38, 39 or 65.1.
Every person who commits an offence under this section is liable to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a fine of not less than $200 and not more than $5,000 plus,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in a case mentioned in paragraph (1)(b.1), an amount of not more than double the total of the amount by which the person’s benefits were reduced under subsection 19(3) and the amount of the benefits that would have been paid to the claimant for the period mentioned in that paragraph if the benefits had not been reduced or the claimant had not been disentitled or disqualified from receiving benefits, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other appropriate case, an amount of not more than double the amount of any benefits that may have been paid as a result of committing the offence; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: both the fine and imprisonment for a term of not more than six months.

Subsection.Text: Every person who contravenes this Act or the regulations is guilty of an offence.
Every person who delays or obstructs a person authorized by the Commission in exercising their powers or performing their duties under this Act or the regulations is guilty of an offence.

Section.Text: Every person who is guilty of an offence under this Act for which no penalty is provided is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than $100 and not more than $2,000 or to imprisonment for a term of not more than six months, or to both.

Every person employed in insurable employment, and every self-employed person in respect of whom Part VII.1 applies, must have a Social Insurance Number that has been assigned to that person under an Act of Parliament.

When the name of a person to whom a Social Insurance Number has been assigned changes because of marriage or otherwise, the person shall inform the Commission of their new name within 60 days after the day on which the change of name becomes effective, unless they have already so informed another authority empowered to receive that information.
For the purposes of sections 138 and 139, the Commission may, with the approval of the Governor in Council, make regulations respecting

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: applications for a Social Insurance Number;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the assignment and use of Social Insurance Numbers;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: requirements that must be met by persons who have been assigned Social Insurance Numbers; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: requirements that must be met by employers.

Section.Text: All reports, recommendations and submissions required to be made to the Governor in Council under this Act, whether by the Commission or otherwise, shall be submitted through the Minister.
In this Part,

Definition.Text: benefit repayment means an amount determined under section 145;
benefits means benefits under this Act, read without reference to this Part;
income of a person for a period means the amount that would be their income for the period determined under the Income Tax Act if no amount were

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: deductible under paragraphs 60(v.1), (w), (y) and (z) of that Act,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: included in respect of a gain from a disposition of property to which section 79 of that Act applies, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: included under paragraph 56(1)(q.1) or subsection 56(6) of that Act;

Definition.Text: Minister means the Minister of National Revenue;
person has the meaning given that term in subsection 248(1) of the Income Tax Act;
taxation year means a taxation year within the meaning of the Income Tax Act.

Subsection.Text: If a claimant’s income for a taxation year exceeds 1.25 times the maximum yearly insurable earnings, the claimant shall repay to the Receiver General 30% of the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the total benefits, other than special benefits and benefits under Part VII.1, paid to the claimant in the taxation year, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount by which the claimant’s income for the taxation year exceeds 1.25 times the maximum yearly insurable earnings.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a claimant who was paid regular benefits for less than one week in the ten years before the taxation year referred to in that subsection.
Regular benefits paid for weeks beginning before June 30, 1996 shall not be taken into account when applying subsection (2).
A repayment must be made

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a claimant who dies after October in the year and before May in the next year, within six months after the day of death; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, on or before April 30 in the next year.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, repayments under this section do not affect the determination under subsection (2) of regular benefits paid to a claimant.

Section.Text: If a claimant is required to make a benefit repayment for a taxation year, a return in a form, and containing information, authorized by the Minister shall, without notice or demand, be filed with the Minister as part of the claimant’s return of income under Part I of the Income Tax Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a claimant who dies after October 31 in the year and before May 1 in the next year, by the claimant’s legal representative within six months after the day of death;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of any other claimant, on or before the claimant’s filing-due date (as defined in subsection 248(1) of the Income Tax Act) for the year, by that claimant or, if for any reason the claimant is unable to file the return, by their guardian, curator, tutor, committee or other legal representative; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the claimant or their legal representative has not filed the return, by such person as is required by notice in writing from the Minister to file the return, within such reasonable time as the notice specifies.

Section.Text: Every claimant or other person required by section 146 to file a return shall, in the return, estimate the amount of benefit repayment payable by them.
The Minister shall administer and enforce the provisions of this Part.

Section.MarginalNote: Application of Income Tax Act provisions
Section.Text: For the purposes of this Part, subsections 150(2) and (3), section 152 (except subsections 152(1.1) to (1.3) and (6)), section 158, subsections 159(1) to (3), sections 160 (except paragraph 160(1)(d)) and 160.1, subsections 161(1) and (11), sections 162 to 167, Division J of Part I, sections 220 to 226, subsection 227(10), sections 229, 239, 243 and 244 and subsections 248(7) and (11) of the Income Tax Act apply, with such modifications as the circumstances require, except that, in the application of those provisions,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “Act” shall be read as “Part VII of the Employment Insurance Act”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “person” and “taxpayer” shall be read as “claimant”;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: “tax” and “taxes” shall be read as “benefit repayment”;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: “under this Part” shall be read as “under Part VII of the Employment Insurance Act”; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 163(2)(a) of the Income Tax Act shall be read as follows:

Subparagraph.Label: “(a)
Subparagraph.Text: the benefit repayment payable by him for the year as determined under section 145 of the Employment Insurance Act;”.

Section.Text: All benefit repayments, interest, penalties and other amounts payable by a claimant under this Part and under the provisions of the Income Tax Act as they apply for the purposes of this Part are debts due to Her Majesty and recoverable in the Federal Court or any other court of competent jurisdiction or in any other manner provided by the Income Tax Act.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding subsection 241(1) of the Income Tax Act, the Minister may communicate, or allow to be communicated, to the Commission, or a person authorized by the Commission, such information obtained under that Act as is necessary for the administration and enforcement of this Part and section 43 of this Act.

In relation to any information obtained under subsection (1), a person authorized by the Commission is an official or authorized person within the meaning of subsection 241(10) of the Income Tax Act and is subject to subsections 239(2.2) and 241(1) and (2) of that Act.

Section.Text: The Minister may, with the approval of the Governor in Council, make regulations

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prescribing anything that by this Part is to be prescribed; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: generally, to carry out the purposes and provisions of this Part.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: balance-due day of a self-employed person for a year means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the person died after October in the year and before May in the immediately following year, the day that is 6 months after the day of death, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, April 30 in the immediately following year.

Definition.Text: business includes a profession, calling, trade, manufacture or undertaking of any kind whatever, and includes an adventure or concern in the nature of trade but does not include an office or employment.
disentitled means not entitled under sections 49, 50, 152.03, 152.15 or 152.2 or under the regulations.
family member, in relation to an individual, means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a spouse or common-law partner of the individual;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a child of the individual or a child of the individual’s spouse or common-law partner;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a parent of the individual or a spouse or common-law partner of the parent; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any other person who is a member of a class of persons prescribed for the purposes of this definition.

Definition.Text: initial claim for benefits means a claim made for the purpose of establishing a self-employed person’s benefit period.
qualifying period means the period described in section 152.08.
self-employed person means an individual who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is or was engaged in a business; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is employed but does not have insurable employment by reason of paragraph 5(2)(b).

ContinuedDefinition.Text: However, individuals to whom regulations made under Part VIII apply, and individuals whose employment is included in insurable employment by a regulation made under paragraph 5(4)(c), are not included in this definition.

Definition.Text: waiting period means the two weeks of the benefit period described in section 152.15.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Amount of self-employed earnings for a year
Subsection.Text: For the purpose of this Part, the amount of the self-employed earnings of a self-employed person for a year is,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a self-employed person who is an individual referred to in paragraph (a) of the definition self-employed person in subsection (1), the amount that is the aggregate of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an amount equal to

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: their income for the year, computed under the Income Tax Act, from their businesses, other than a business more than fifty per cent of the gross revenue of which consisted of rent from land or buildings,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: all losses, computed under the Income Tax Act, sustained by the self-employed person in the year in carrying on the businesses they are engaged in, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: their income for the year from employment described in paragraph 5(6)(c) that has been excluded from insurable employment by a regulation made under subsection 5(6), as that income is computed under the Income Tax Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a self-employed person who is an individual referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition self-employed person in subsection (1), the amount that would have been the person’s insurable earnings for the year had the person’s employment not been excluded from insurable employment; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a self-employed person who is an individual referred to in both paragraphs (a) and (b), the amount that is the aggregate of the amounts referred to in both those paragraphs.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of clause (2)(a)(i)(A), the income of an Indian, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Indian Act, on a reserve, as defined in that subsection, is to be calculated without reference to paragraph 81(1)(a) of the Income Tax Act.
For the purpose of this Part, a week of unemployment for a self-employed person is a week of unemployment as defined or determined in accordance with the regulations.

A reference in this Part to an amount equal to a percentage or fraction of earnings or benefits in a period shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of one dollar or, if the amount is equidistant from two multiples of one dollar, to the higher multiple.

This Part applies in respect of every self-employed person who is a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident within the meaning of subsection 2(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act who has entered into an agreement with the Commission regarding the application of this Part.
Subject to subsections (4) to (7), the agreements are of indefinite duration.
The Commission may fix the form and the conditions of the agreements.

An agreement is deemed to be terminated if any of the circumstances set out in the regulations exist. It may also be terminated, by notice given to the Commission in the prescribed form and manner, by the individual who entered into it if the notice is given before any benefits are paid to the individual under this Part or, if benefits have been paid under this Part, if any of the prescribed circumstances exist. It may not be terminated in any other manner or at any other time.
If an agreement is deemed to be terminated as a result of circumstances set out in the regulations, the agreement is deemed to be terminated on the prescribed date.
If notice is given to terminate an agreement in accordance with subsection (4), the agreement is terminated on December 31 of the year in which the notice is given unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a benefit period is established under this Part for the individual during the period that begins on the date the notice was given and that ends on December 31 of that year, in which case the notice is deemed never to have been given; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the individual withdraws the notice in the prescribed manner before December 31 of the year in which the notice was given.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (6), if the notice is given within 60 days after the agreement was entered into, the agreement is deemed never to have been entered into.

Subject to this Part, a self-employed person who ceases to work as a self-employed person because of a prescribed illness, injury or quarantine and who would be otherwise working, is entitled to receive benefits while unable to work as a self-employed person for that reason.

A self-employed person to whom benefits are payable under any of sections 152.05 to 152.061 is entitled to benefits under subsection (1) even though the person did not cease to work as a self-employed person because of a prescribed illness, injury or quarantine and would not be working even without the illness, injury or quarantine.

If benefits are payable to a self-employed person as a result of illness, injury or quarantine and any allowances, money or other benefits are payable to the person for that illness, injury or quarantine under a provincial law, the benefits payable to the person under this Part shall be reduced or eliminated as prescribed.

If benefits are payable under this section to a self-employed person who receives earnings for a period in a week of unemployment during which the person is incapable of working as a self-employed person because of illness, injury or quarantine, subsection 152.18(2) does not apply and, subject to subsection 152.18(3), all those earnings shall be deducted from the benefits payable for that week.

A self-employed person, other than one referred to in subsection (1.1), is not entitled to benefits under subsection (1) if, were it not for the prescribed illness, injury or quarantine, the self-employed person would be deemed, in accordance with the regulations, to be not working.
Subject to this Part, benefits are payable to a self-employed person who proves her pregnancy.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Weeks for which benefits may be paid
Subsection.Text: Subject to section 152.14, benefits are payable to a self-employed person under this section for each week of unemployment in the period

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that begins the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: eight weeks before the week in which her confinement is expected, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the week in which her confinement occurs; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that ends 17 weeks after the later of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the week in which her confinement is expected, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the week in which her confinement occurs.

Subsection.Text: When benefits are payable to a self-employed person for unemployment caused by pregnancy and any allowances, money or other benefits are payable to the person for that pregnancy under a provincial law, the benefits payable to the self-employed person under this Part shall be reduced or eliminated as prescribed.

If benefits are payable under this section to a self-employed person who receives earnings for a period that falls in a week in the period described in subsection (2), the provisions of subsection 152.18(2) do not apply and, subject to subsection 152.18(3), all those earnings shall be deducted from the benefits paid for that week.

If a child who is born of the self-employed person’s pregnancy is hospitalized, the period for which benefits are payable under subsection (2) shall be extended by the number of weeks during which the child is hospitalized.
The extended period shall end no later than 52 weeks after the week of confinement.

Subject to this Part, benefits are payable to a self-employed person to care for one or more new-born children of the person or one or more children placed with the person for the purpose of adoption under the laws governing adoption in the province in which the person resides.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Weeks for which benefits may be paid
Subsection.Text: Subject to section 152.14, benefits under this section are payable for each week of unemployment in the period

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that begins with the week in which the child or children of the self-employed person are born or the child or children are actually placed with the self-employed person for the purpose of adoption; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that ends 52 weeks after the week in which the child or children of the self-employed person are born or the child or children are actually placed with the self-employed person for the purpose of adoption.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Extension of period — child in hospital
Subsection.Text: If the child or children referred to in subsection (1) are hospitalized during the period referred to in subsection (2), the period is extended by the number of weeks during which the child or children are hospitalized.
No extension under subsection (3) may result in the period being longer than 104 weeks.

If, during a self-employed person’s benefit period, benefits were paid to the person for more than one of the reasons mentioned in paragraphs 152.14(1)(a) to (e), the maximum total number of weeks established for those reasons is greater than 50 and benefits were paid for the reason mentioned in paragraph 152.14(1)(b) but for fewer than the maximum number of weeks established for that reason, the period referred to in subsection (2) is extended so that benefits may be paid up to the maximum number of weeks referred to in paragraph 152.14(1)(b).
An extension under subsection (5) must not result in the period referred to in subsection (2) being longer than the maximum benefit period calculated under subsection 152.11(16).
An extension under any of subsections 152.11(11) to (14) must not result in the period referred to in subsection (2) being longer than 104 weeks.

If benefits are payable to a self-employed person for the reasons set out in this section and any allowances, money or other benefits are payable to the person for the same reasons under a provincial law, the benefits payable to the self-employed person under this Part are to be reduced or eliminated as prescribed.

If two self-employed persons each make a claim for benefits under this section — or if one self-employed person makes a claim for benefits under this section and a person makes a claim for benefits under section 23 — in respect of the same child or children, the weeks of benefits payable under this section, under section 23 or under both of those sections, up to a maximum of 35 weeks, may be divided between them.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Maximum number of weeks that can be divided
Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, if, in respect of the same child or children, a self-employed person makes a claim for benefits under this section and another person makes a claim for benefits under section 23, the total number of weeks of benefits payable under this section and section 23 that may be divided between them may not exceed 35 weeks.

A self-employed person who makes a claim for benefits under this section may have his or her waiting period deferred until he or she makes another claim for benefits in the same benefit period, otherwise than under section 152.04 or this section, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the self-employed person has already made a claim for benefits under section 152.04 or this section in respect of the same child or children and has served the waiting period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: another self-employed person has made a claim for benefits under section 152.04 or this section in respect of the same child or children and that other self-employed person has served or is serving his or her waiting period;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: another self-employed person is making a claim for benefits under section 152.04 or this section in respect of the same child or children at the same time as the self-employed person and that other self-employed person elects to serve the waiting period; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the self-employed person or another self-employed person meets the prescribed requirements.

Subsection.Text: If a self-employed person makes a claim under this Part and another person makes a claim under section 22 or 23 in respect of the same child or children and one of them has served or elected to serve their waiting period, then

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the self-employed person is not the one who served or elected to serve the waiting period, the self-employed person is not required to serve a waiting period; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the person making the claim under section 22 or 23 is not the one who served or elected to serve the waiting period, the person may have his or her waiting period deferred in accordance with section 23.

Subsection.Text: Subject to this Part, benefits are payable to a self-employed person if a medical doctor has issued a certificate stating that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a family member of the self-employed person has a serious medical condition with a significant risk of death within 26 weeks

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: from the day on which the certificate is issued, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a claim that is made before the day on which the certificate is issued, from the day from which the medical doctor certifies the family member’s medical condition; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the family member requires the care or support of one or more other family members.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances set out in the regulations, the certificate required under subsection (1) may be issued by a member of a prescribed class of medical practitioners.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Weeks for which benefits may be paid
Subsection.Text: Subject to section 152.14, benefits under this section are payable for each week of unemployment in the period

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that begins on the first day of the week in which one of the following falls, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the day of issuance of the first certificate in respect of the family member that meets the requirements of subsection (1) and is filed with the Commission, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a claim that is made before the day on which the certificate is issued, the day from which the medical doctor certifies the family member’s medical condition; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that ends on the last day of the week in which any of the following occurs, namely,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all benefits payable under this section in respect of the family member are exhausted,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the family member dies, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the period of 52 weeks following the first day of the week referred to in paragraph (a) ends.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, but subject to subsections (3) and 50(8.1), for benefits under this section to be payable after the end of the period of 26 weeks set out in paragraph (1)(a), it is not necessary for a medical doctor to issue an additional certificate under subsection (1).
If a shorter period is prescribed for the purposes of this section,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the certificate referred to in subsection (1) must state that the family member has a serious medical condition with a significant risk of death within that period; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that period applies for the purposes of subparagraph (3)(b)(iii).

Subsection.Text: Subparagraph (3)(a)(ii) does not apply to a claim if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the time the certificate is filed with the Commission, all benefits that may otherwise have been payable in relation to that claim have already been exhausted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the beginning of the period referred to in subsection (3) has already been determined with respect to the family member, and the filing of the certificate with the Commission would have the effect of moving the beginning of that period to an earlier date; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the claim is made in any other circumstances set out in the regulations.

Subsection.Text: A self-employed person who makes a claim for benefits under this section may have their waiting period deferred until they make another claim for benefits in the same benefit period if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: another claimant has made a claim for benefits under this section or section 23.1 in respect of the same family member during the period described in subsection (3) and that other claimant has served or is serving their waiting period in respect of that claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: another claimant is making a claim for benefits under this section or section 23.1 in respect of the same family member at the same time as the self-employed person and that other claimant elects to serve the waiting period; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the self-employed person, or another claimant who has made a claim for benefits under this section or section 23.1 in respect of the same family member, meets the prescribed requirements.

Subsection.Text: If a self-employed person makes a claim for benefits under this section and another person makes a claim for benefits under this section or section 23.1 in respect of the same family member, any remaining weeks of benefits payable under this section, under section 23.1 or under both those sections, up to a maximum of 26 weeks, may be divided in the manner agreed to by the self-employed person and the other person. If they cannot agree, the weeks of benefits are to be divided in accordance with the prescribed rules.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Maximum number of weeks that can be divided
Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, if, in respect of the same family member, a self-employed person makes a claim for benefits under this section and another person makes a claim for benefits under section 23.1, the total number of weeks of benefits payable under this section and section 23.1 that may be divided between them may not exceed 26 weeks.

If benefits are payable to a self-employed person for the reasons set out in this section and any allowances, money or other benefits are payable to the person under a provincial law for the same or substantially the same reasons, the benefits payable to the person under this section shall be reduced or eliminated as prescribed.

Subject to this Part, benefits are payable to a self-employed person, who is the parent of a critically ill child, in order to care for or support that child if a specialist medical doctor has issued a certificate that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: states that the child is a critically ill child and requires the care or support of one or more of their parents; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sets out the period during which the child requires that care or support.

Subsection.Text: In the circumstances set out in the regulations, the certificate referred to in subsection (1) may be issued by a member of a prescribed class of medical practitioners.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Weeks for which benefits may be paid — child
Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4) and section 152.14, benefits under this section are payable for each week of unemployment in the period

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that begins on the first day of the week in which either of the following falls:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which the first certificate is issued in respect of the child that meets the requirements of subsection (1) and is filed with the Commission, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a claim that is made before the day on which the certificate is issued, the day from which the specialist medical doctor certifies that the child is critically ill; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that ends on the last day of the week in which any of the following occurs:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all benefits payable under this section in respect of the child are exhausted,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the child dies, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry of 52 weeks following the first day of the week referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Weeks for which benefits may be paid — children
Subsection.Text: Subject to section 152.14, if more than one child of the self-employed person is critically ill as a result of the same event, benefits under this section are payable for each week of unemployment in the period

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that begins on the first day of the week in which either of the following falls:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which the first certificate is issued in respect of any of the children that meets the requirements of subsection (1) and is filed with the Commission, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a claim that is made before the day on which the certificate is issued, the first day from which the specialist medical doctor certifies that any of the children is critically ill; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that ends on the last day of the week in which any of the following occurs:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all benefits payable under this section in respect of the children are exhausted,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the last of the children dies, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry of 52 weeks following the first day of the week referred to in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: Subparagraph (3)(a)(ii) or (4)(a)(ii) does not apply to a claim if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the time the certificate is filed with the Commission, all benefits that may otherwise have been payable in relation to that claim have already been exhausted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the beginning of the period referred to in subsection (3) or (4), as the case may be, has already been determined and the filing of the certificate with the Commission would have the effect of moving the beginning of that period to an earlier date; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the claim is made in any other circumstances set out in the regulations.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (7), a self-employed person who makes a claim for benefits under this section may have their waiting period deferred until they make another claim for benefits in the same benefit period if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: another claimant has made a claim for benefits under this section or section 23.2 in respect of the same child during the period described in subsection (3) and that other claimant has served or is serving their waiting period in respect of that claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: another claimant is making a claim for benefits under this section or section 23.2 in respect of the same child at the same time as the claimant and that other claimant elects to serve their waiting period; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the self-employed person, or another claimant who has made a claim for benefits under this section or section 23.2 in respect of the same child, meets the prescribed requirements.

Subsection.Text: A self-employed person who makes a claim for benefits under this section — and more than one of whose children is critically ill as a result of the same event — may have their waiting period deferred until they make another claim for benefits in the same benefit period if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: another claimant has made a claim for benefits under this section or section 23.2 in respect of the same children during the period described in subsection (4) and that other claimant has served or is serving their waiting period in respect of that claim;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: another claimant is making a claim for benefits under this section or section 23.2 in respect of the same children at the same time as the claimant and that other claimant elects to serve their waiting period; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the self-employed person, or another claimant who has made a claim for benefits under this section or section 23.2 in respect of the same children, meets the prescribed requirements.

Subsection.Text: If a self-employed person makes a claim for benefits under this section and another person makes a claim for benefits under this section or section 23.2 in respect of the same child or the same children who are critically ill as a result of the same event, any remaining weeks of benefits payable under this section, under section 23.2 or under both those sections, up to a maximum of 35 weeks, may be divided in the manner agreed to by the self-employed person and the other person. If they cannot agree, the weeks of benefits are to be divided in accordance with the prescribed rules.

For greater certainty, if, in respect of the same child or the same children who are critically ill as a result of the same event, a self-employed person makes a claim for benefits under this section and another person makes a claim for benefits under section 23.2, the total number of weeks of benefits payable under this section and section 23.2 that may be divided between them must not exceed 35 weeks.
Benefits under section 23.1 or 152.06 are not payable in respect of a child during the period referred to in subsection (3) or (4) or 23.2(3) or (4) that is established in respect of that child.

When benefits are payable to a self-employed person for the reasons set out in this section and any allowances, money or other benefits are payable to the person under a provincial law for the same or substantially the same reasons, the benefits payable to the person under this section shall be reduced or eliminated as prescribed.
A self-employed person qualifies for benefits if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at least 12 months have expired since the day on which the person entered into an agreement referred to in subsection 152.02(1) with the Commission, or if a period has been prescribed for the purpose of this section, a period that is at least as long as that prescribed period has expired since that day;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the agreement has not been terminated or deemed to have been terminated;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person has had an interruption of earnings from self-employment; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the person has had during their qualifying period an amount of self-employed earnings that is equal to or greater than the following amount:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: $6,000 or the amount fixed or determined in accordance with the regulations, if any, for that qualifying period, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the person has accumulated a violation in the 260 weeks before making their initial claim for benefits, the amount referred to in this paragraph that would otherwise apply in respect of that self-employed person but for this subparagraph multiplied by,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: if the violation is a minor violation, 1.25 or the prescribed multiplier, if one has been prescribed,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: if the violation is a serious violation, 1.5 or the prescribed multiplier, if one has been prescribed,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: if the violation is a very serious violation, 1.75 or the prescribed multiplier, if one has been prescribed, or

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: if the violation is a subsequent violation, 2 or the prescribed multiplier, if one has been prescribed.

Subsection.Text: A self-employed person accumulates a violation if in any of the following circumstances the Commission issues a notice of violation to the person:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: one or more penalties are imposed on the person under section 38, or under section 41.1 as a result of acts or omissions mentioned in section 38;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person is found guilty of one or more offences under section 135 or 136 as a result of acts or omissions mentioned in those sections; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person is found guilty of one or more offences under the Criminal Code as a result of acts or omissions relating to the application of this Act.

Subsection.Text: The value of a violation is the total of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the overpayment of benefits under this Part resulting from the acts or omissions on which the violation is based, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the self-employed person is disentitled from receiving benefits under this Part, or the act or omission on which the violation is based relates to qualification requirements under subsection (1), the amount determined, subject to subsection (4), by multiplying the self-employed person’s weekly rate of benefits by the average number of weeks of benefits under this Part, as determined under the regulations.

Subsection.Text: The maximum amount to be determined under paragraph (3)(b) is the amount of benefits that could have been paid to the self-employed person if they had not been disentitled or had met the qualification requirements under subsection (1).
Except for violations for which a warning was imposed, each violation is classified as a minor, serious, very serious or subsequent violation as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the value of the violation is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: less than $1,000, it is a minor violation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: $1,000 or more, but less than $5,000, it is a serious violation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: $5,000 or more, it is a very serious violation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the notice of violation is issued within 260 weeks after the person accumulates another violation, it is a subsequent violation, even if the acts or omissions on which it is based occurred before the person accumulated the other violation.

Subsection.Text: A violation accumulated by an individual under section 7.1 is deemed to be a violation accumulated by the individual under this section on the day on which the notice of violation was given to the individual.

A violation may not be taken into account under paragraph (1)(d) in more than two initial claims by an individual for benefits under this Act if the individual who accumulated the violation qualified for benefits in each of those two initial claims, taking into account subsection 7.1(1) or (2), subparagraph (1)(d)(ii) or regulations made under Part VIII, as the case may be.
The qualifying period of a self-employed person is the year immediately before the year during which their benefit period begins.
A self-employed person’s self-employed earnings during a qualifying period may not be taken into account in respect of more than one initial claim for benefits.

Section.MarginalNote: Benefits under this Part and Part I

Subsection.Text: If an individual qualifies for benefits under this Part as a self-employed person and for benefits under Part I as an insured person, the individual may receive benefits under one Part only and, to do so, the individual must, in the prescribed manner, at the time of making an initial claim for benefits, elect under which Part benefits are to be paid.

The election is binding on the individual in respect of the initial claim for all benefits payable, for any of the following reasons, during the benefit period established in relation to the initial claim:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pregnancy;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: caring for one or more new-born children of the self-employed person, or one or more children placed with the self-employed person for the purpose of adoption;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a prescribed illness, injury or quarantine;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: providing care or support to one or more family members; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: providing care or support to one or more critically ill children of the self-employed person.

Subsection.Text: When a self-employed person who qualifies under section 152.07 makes an initial claim for benefits, a benefit period shall be established and, once it is established, benefits are payable to the person in accordance with this Part for each week of unemployment that falls in the benefit period.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Conditions for establishment of benefit period
Subsection.Text: No benefit period is to be established for a self-employed person unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person makes an initial claim for benefits in accordance with section 50 and the regulations and proves that the person is qualified to receive benefits; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person supplies information in the form and manner directed by the Commission, giving the person’s employment circumstances and the circumstances pertaining to any interruption of earnings, and any other information that the Commission may require.

Subsection.Text: A benefit period begins on the later of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Sunday of the week in which the interruption of earnings occurs,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Sunday of the week in which the initial claim for benefits is made.

Subsection.Text: The length of a benefit period is 52 weeks, except as otherwise provided in subsections (11) to (19).
Subject to any change or cancellation of a benefit period under this section, a benefit period shall not be established for a self-employed person if a prior benefit period has not ended.

An initial claim for benefits made after the day on which the self-employed person first qualified to make the claim shall be regarded as having been made on an earlier day if the self-employed person shows that they qualified to receive benefits on the earlier day and that there was good cause for the delay throughout the period that begins on the earlier day and ends on the day on which the initial claim was made.

A claim for benefits, other than an initial claim for benefits, made after the time prescribed for making the claim shall be regarded as having been made on an earlier day if the self-employed person shows that there was good cause for the delay throughout the period that begins on the earlier day and ends on the day on which their claim was made.
A claim for benefits referred to in section 152.06 with respect to a family member shall not be regarded as having been made on an earlier day under subsection (4) or (5) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the time the claim is made, all benefits that may otherwise have been payable in relation to that claim have already been exhausted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the beginning of the period referred to in subsection 152.06(3) has already been determined with respect to that family member and the claim would have the effect of moving the beginning of that period to an earlier date; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the claim is made in any other circumstances set out in the regulations.

Subsection.Text: A claim for benefits referred to in section 152.061 with respect to a critically ill child or children who are critically ill as a result of the same event must not be regarded as having been made on an earlier day under subsection (4) or (5) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the time the claim is made, all benefits that may otherwise have been payable in relation to that claim have already been exhausted;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the beginning of the period referred to in subsection 152.061(3) or (4) has already been determined with respect to that child or those children and the claim would have the effect of moving the beginning of that period to an earlier date; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the claim is made in any other circumstances set out in the regulations.

Subsection.Text: Once a benefit period has been established for a self-employed person, the Commission may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cancel the benefit period if it has ended and no benefits were paid or payable during the period; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whether or not the period has ended, cancel at the request of the self-employed person that portion of the benefit period immediately before the first week for which benefits were paid or payable, if the self-employed person

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: establishes under this Part — or establishes under Part 1, as an insured person — a new benefit period beginning the first week for which benefits were paid or payable, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: shows that there was good cause for the delay in making the request throughout the period that begins on the day on which benefits were first paid or payable and ends on the day on which the request for cancellation was made.

Subsection.Text: A cancelled benefit period or portion of a benefit period is deemed never to have begun.
A benefit period ends when any of the following first occurs:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no further benefits are payable to the self-employed person in their benefit period, including for the reason that benefits have been paid for the maximum number of weeks for which benefits may be paid under section 152.14;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the benefit period would otherwise end under this section; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the self-employed person

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: requests that their benefit period end,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: makes a new initial claim for benefits, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: qualifies to receive benefits under this Part or qualifies, as an insured person, to receive benefits under Part I.

Subsection.Text: Whether or not the benefit period has ended, a request under paragraph (9)(c) shall be regarded as having been made on an earlier day if the self-employed person shows that there was good cause for the delay throughout the period that begins on the earlier day and ends on the day on which the request was made.

A self-employed person’s benefit period is extended by the aggregate of any weeks during the benefit period for which the self-employed person proves, in the manner that the Commission may direct, that they were not entitled to benefits because they were

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: confined in a jail, penitentiary or other similar institution and were not found guilty of the offence for which they were being held or any other offence arising out of the same transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in receipt of earnings paid because of the complete severance of their relationship with their former employer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in receipt of workers’ compensation payments for an illness or injury; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in receipt of payments under a provincial law on the basis of having ceased to work because continuing to work would have resulted in danger to the self-employed person, her unborn child or a child whom she was breast-feeding.

Subsection.Text: A self-employed person’s benefit period is extended by the aggregate of any weeks during an extension of a benefit period under subsection (11) for which the self-employed person proves, in the manner that the Commission may direct, that they were not entitled to benefits because of a reason specified in that subsection.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Extension of benefit period — child in hospital
Subsection.Text: If the child or children referred to in subsection 152.05(1) are hospitalized during the period referred to in subsection 152.05(2), the benefit period is extended by the number of weeks during which the child or children are hospitalized.

If, during a self-employed person’s benefit period, benefits were paid to the person for more than one of the reasons mentioned in paragraphs 152.14(1)(a) to (e), at least one of those benefits was paid for fewer than the applicable maximum number of weeks established for those reasons and the maximum total number of weeks established for those reasons is greater than 50, the benefit period is extended so that those benefits may be paid up to that maximum total number of weeks.
Subject to subsection (16), an extension under any of subsections (11) to (14) must not result in a benefit period of more than 104 weeks.

Unless the benefit period is also extended under any of subsections (11) to (13), an extension under subsection (14) must not result in a benefit period of more than the sum of two weeks and the total of the maximum number of weeks established under subsection 152.14(1) for each of the benefits paid to the self-employed person for one of the reasons mentioned in paragraphs 152.14(1)(a) to (e) during the person’s benefit period before it was extended under subsection (14).

Section.Text: On receiving an initial claim for benefits, the Commission shall decide whether the self-employed person is qualified to receive benefits and notify the person of its decision.

If a benefit period has been established for a self-employed person, benefits may be paid to the person for each week of unemployment that falls in the benefit period, subject to the maximums established by section 152.14.

Subsection.Text: The maximum number of weeks for which benefits under this Part may be paid in a benefit period to a self-employed person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: because of pregnancy is 15;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: because the self-employed person is caring for one or more new-born children of the self-employed person, or one or more children placed with the self-employed person for the purpose of adoption, is 35;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: because of a prescribed illness, injury or quarantine is 15;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: because the person is providing care or support to one or more family members described in subsection 152.06(1) is 26; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: because the self-employed person is providing care or support to one or more critically ill children described in subsection 152.061(1), is 35.

Subsection.Text: The maximum number of weeks for which benefits under this Part may be paid to a self-employed person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for a single pregnancy is 15; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for the care of one or more new-born or adopted children as a result of a single pregnancy or placement is 35.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Part, the placement with a self-employed person, at the same or substantially the same time, of two or more children for the purpose of adoption is to be regarded as a single placement of a child or children for the purpose of adoption.

If a claim is made under this Part in respect of a child or children referred to in paragraph (2)(b) and a claim is made under section 23 in respect of the same child or children, the maximum number of weeks of benefits payable under this Act in respect of the child or children is 35.

Even if more than one claim is made under this Act, at least one of which is made under section 152.06 — or even if more than one certificate is issued for the purposes of this Act, at least one of which is issued for the purposes of section 152.06 — for the same reason and in respect of the same family member, the maximum number of weeks of benefits payable under this Act in respect of that family member is 26 weeks during the period of 52 weeks that begins on the first day of the week referred to in paragraph 152.06(3)(a).

Even if more than one claim is made under this Act, at least one of which is made under section 152.061 — or even if more than one certificate is issued for the purposes of this Act, at least one of which is issued for the purposes of section 152.061 — for the same reason and in respect of the same critically ill child, the maximum number of weeks of benefits payable under this Act in respect of that child is 35 weeks during the period of 52 weeks that begins on the first day of the week referred to in paragraph 152.061(3)(a).

Even if more than one claim is made under this Act, at least one of which is made under section 152.061 — or even if more than one certificate is issued for the purposes of this Act, at least one of which is issued for the purposes of section 152.061 — for the same reason and in respect of the same children who are critically ill as a result of the same event, the maximum number of weeks of benefits payable under this Act in respect of those children is 35 weeks during the period of 52 weeks that begins on the first day of the week referred to in paragraph 152.061(4)(a).
If a shorter period is prescribed for the purposes of subsection 152.06(4), then that shorter period applies for the purposes of subsection (5).

When a shorter period referred to in subsection (6) has expired in respect of a family member, no further benefits are payable under section 152.06 in respect of that family member until the minimum prescribed number of weeks has elapsed.

In a self-employed person’s benefit period, the self-employed person may, subject to the applicable maximums, combine weeks of benefits to which they are entitled because of a reason mentioned in subsection (1), but the maximum number of combined weeks is 50. However, if the benefit period is extended under subsection 152.11(14), the maximum number of combined weeks equals the maximum number of weeks in the benefit period calculated under subsection 152.11(16) less two weeks.

Section.Text: A self-employed person is not entitled to be paid benefits in a benefit period until, after the beginning of the benefit period, the person has served a two week waiting period that begins with a week of unemployment for which benefits would otherwise be payable.

Subsection.Text: The rate of weekly benefits payable to a self-employed person is 55% of the result obtained by dividing the aggregate of the amounts referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b) by 52:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of their self-employed earnings, determined under paragraph 152.01(2)(a), (b) or (c), as the case may be, for their qualifying period; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if they had insurable earnings from employment, including insurable earnings earned as a person to whom regulations made under Part VIII apply, for their qualifying period, the amount of those insurable earnings for that period, calculated without taking into account prescribed insurable earnings.

Subsection.Text: Only the portion of the aggregate of the amounts referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) that does not exceed the maximum yearly insurable earnings as calculated under section 4 is to be taken into account for the purposes of subsection (1).

The rate of weekly benefits of a self-employed person who has one or more dependent children shall be increased by the amount of a family supplement determined in accordance with the regulations if the person establishes, in the manner that the Commission may direct, that the person meets the prescribed low-income family eligibility criteria.
The criteria for low-income family eligibility may include criteria that are the same as or similar to the criteria for receiving a child tax benefit.
For the purposes of subsection (2), a child tax benefit is a deemed overpayment under subdivision a.1 of Division E of Part I of the Income Tax Act.

The amount of the increase in the self-employed person’s rate of weekly benefits shall not exceed the prescribed percentage of their amount of self-employed earnings for the year divided by 52 or, if no percentage is prescribed, 25%.
The maximum rate of weekly benefits that may be paid under this section is 55% of the maximum yearly insurable earnings, as calculated under section 4, divided by 52.

If a self-employed person has earnings during their waiting period, an amount not exceeding those earnings shall, as prescribed, be deducted from the benefits payable for the first three weeks for which benefits would otherwise be payable.

Subject to subsection (3), if the self-employed person has earnings during any other week of unemployment, there shall be deducted from benefits payable in that week the amount, if any, of the earnings that exceeds

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: $50, if their rate of weekly benefits is less than $200; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: 25% of their rate of weekly benefits, if that rate is $200 or more.

Subsection.Text: If the self-employed person has failed to declare all or some of their earnings to the Commission for a period, determined under the regulations, for which benefits were claimed,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the following amount shall be deducted from the benefits paid to the person for that period:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount of the undeclared earnings, if, in the opinion of the Commission, the person knowingly failed to declare the earnings, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, the amount of the undeclared earnings less the difference between

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: all amounts determined under paragraph (2)(a) or (b) for the period,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: all amounts that were applied under those paragraphs in respect of the declared earnings for the period; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the deduction shall be made

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: from the benefits paid for a number of weeks that begins with the first week for which the earnings were not declared in that period, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in such a manner that the amount deducted in each consecutive week equals the person’s benefits paid for that week.

Section.MarginalNote: Deduction for excluded days in waiting period

Subsection.Text: If a self-employed person is not entitled to receive benefits for a working day in their waiting period, an amount equal to 1/5 of their weekly rate of benefits for each such working day shall be deducted from the benefits payable for the three weeks described in subsection 152.18(1).

Subsection.MarginalNote: Deduction for excluded days not in waiting period
Subsection.Text: If a self-employed person is disentitled from receiving benefits for a working day in a week of unemployment that is not in their waiting period, an amount equal to 1/5 of their weekly rate of benefits for each such working day shall be deducted from the benefits payable for that week.

Section.MarginalNote: Prison inmates and persons outside Canada
Section.Text: Except as may otherwise be prescribed, a self-employed person is not entitled to receive benefits for any period during which the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is an inmate of a prison or similar institution; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not in Canada.

Subsection.Text: Every self-employed person who has entered into an agreement referred to in subsection 152.02(1) that has not been terminated or that is not deemed to have been terminated shall, in respect of every year, pay a self-employment premium equal to the amount determined under subsection (2) multiplied by the premium rate set under section 66 or 66.32, as the case may be.
The amount for the purpose of subsection (1) is the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the person’s self-employed earnings for the year,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the maximum yearly insurable earnings for the year, as calculated under section 4, minus the person’s insurable earnings, if any.

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, a premium is required to be paid

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the year during which the self-employed person entered into the agreement, regardless of the date on which it was entered into; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the year during which the agreement is terminated or deemed to be terminated, regardless of the date on which it was terminated or deemed to be terminated.

Heading.TitleText: Self-employed Earnings and Collection of Premiums

Subsection.Text: If a self-employed person is required to pay a premium for a year in respect of their self-employed earnings, a return of the person’s self-employed earnings for the year shall, without notice or demand for it, be filed with the Minister of National Revenue in the form and manner, and containing the information, specified by that Minister, by that person (or, if the person is unable for any reason to file the return, by their representative) on or before the day on which the person’s return of income under Part I of the Income Tax Act is required by that Part to be filed or would be required by that Part to be filed if tax under that Part were payable for the year.

Whether or not they are liable to pay a premium for a year in respect of their earnings from self-employment and whether or not a return has been filed under subsection (1), every self-employed person shall, on demand from the Minister of National Revenue, served personally or by registered letter, file with that Minister, in the form and containing information specified by that Minister, within any reasonable time that may be specified in the demand, a return of their earnings from self-employment for the year designated in the demand.

Every trustee in bankruptcy, assignee, liquidator, curator, receiver, receiver-manager trustee or committee and every agent, mandatary or other person administering, managing, winding-up, controlling or otherwise dealing with the property, business, estate or succession, or income of a self-employed person who has not filed a return of the person’s self-employed earnings for a year as required by this section must file with the Minister of National Revenue a return, in the form specified by that Minister, of the person’s self-employed earnings for the year.
The information to be contained in any such return must identify the province in which the self-employed person was resident on the last day of that year.

Section.Text: Every self-employed person required by section 152.22 to file a return of their self-employed earnings must, in the return, estimate the amount of the premium to be paid in respect of those earnings.

Section.MarginalNote: Examination of return and notice of assessment
Section.Text: The Minister of National Revenue must, with all due dispatch, examine each return of self-employed earnings and assess the premium to be paid for the year in respect of those earnings and the interest and penalties, if any, payable, and, after the examination, send a notice of assessment to the person who filed the return.

Subsection.Text: A self-employed person shall, on or before their balance-due day for the year, pay to the Receiver General the whole amount of the premium if they are not required by section 155 or 156 of the Income Tax Act to pay instalments for that year in respect of their income tax.

Every self-employed person to whom section 155 of the Income Tax Act applies, other than a person to whom subsection (1) applies, shall pay to the Receiver General on or before December 31 in each year, two thirds of the following amounts:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the premium required to be paid by the person for the year in respect of the person’s self-employed earnings, as estimated by the person; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the premium required in respect of the person’s self-employed earnings for the preceding year.

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: In addition, the person shall pay to the Receiver General, on or before the person’s balance-due day for the year, the remainder of the premium as estimated under section 152.23. However, paragraphs (a) and (b) do not require the payment of any amount in respect of the person that would otherwise become due after the death of the person.

Subsection.Text: Every self-employed person, other than a person to whom subsection (1) or (2) applies, shall pay to the Receiver General in respect of each year

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on or before March 15, June 15, September 15 and December 15 in the year, an amount equal to one quarter of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the premium required to be paid by the person for the year in respect of the person’s self-employed earnings, as estimated by the person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the premium required in respect of the person’s self-employed earnings for the preceding year; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on or before

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: March 15 and June 15 in the year, an amount equal to one quarter of the premium required in respect of the person’s self-employed earnings for the second preceding year, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: September 15 and December 15 in the year, an amount equal to one half of the amount, if any, by which

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the premium required in respect of the person’s self-employed earnings for the preceding year

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: one half of the premium required in respect of the person’s self-employed earnings for the second preceding year.

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: In addition, the person shall pay to the Receiver General, on or before the person’s balance-due day for the year, the remainder of the premium as estimated under section 152.23. However, paragraphs (a) and (b) do not require the payment of any amount in respect of the person that would otherwise become due after the death of the person.

Subsection.Text: If the amount paid by a self-employed person on or before the person’s balance-due day for a year on account of the premium required to be paid by the person for the year in respect of the person’s self-employed earnings is less than the amount of the premium so required to be paid, the self-employed person shall pay to the Receiver General interest, at a rate per year prescribed by regulation made under subsection (5), on the difference between those amounts from the balance-due day for the year to the day of payment.

In addition to any interest payable under subsection (1), if a self-employed person, being required by section 152.25 to pay a part or instalment of a premium, has failed to pay all or any part of a premium as required, the person shall, on payment of the amount the person failed so to pay, pay to the Receiver General interest on the amount, at a rate per year prescribed by regulation made under subsection (5), from the day on or before which the person was required to make the payment to the day of payment or the beginning of the period in respect of which the person is liable to pay interest on the amount under subsection (1), whichever is earlier.

For the purposes of subsection (2), if a self-employed person is required by subsection 152.25(2) to pay a part or instalment of a premium in respect of their self-employed earnings, the person is deemed to have been liable to pay on or before the day referred to in that subsection a part or instalment computed by reference to whichever of the following that gives rise to the least amount required to be paid by the person on or before that day:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the premium required to be paid by them for the year in respect of their self-employed earnings;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the premium required in respect of their self-employed earnings for the preceding year; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount stated to be the amount of the instalment payable by them for the year in the notice, if any, sent to them by the Minister of National Revenue.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (2), if a self-employed person is required by subsection 152.25(3) to pay a part or instalment of a premium in respect of their self-employed earnings, the person is deemed to have been liable to pay on or before each day referred to in that subsection a part or instalment computed by reference to whichever of the following that gives rise to the least total amount of those parts or instalments required to be paid by them by that day:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the premium required to be paid by them for the year in respect of their self-employed earnings;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amounts determined under paragraph 152.25(3)(b) in respect of them for the year;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amounts stated to be the amounts of instalment payable by them for the year in the notices, if any, sent to them by the Minister of National Revenue; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
